nothing by myself; yet am I not hereby justified:</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;but he that judgeth me is the Lord.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>004:005 Therefore judge nothing before the time   until the Lord come</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;who both will bring to light the hidden things of darkness</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;and will make manifest the counsels of the hearts: and then</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;shall every man have praise of God.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>004:006 And these things   brethren   I have in a figure transferred to</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;myself and to Apollos for your sakes; that ye might learn in</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;us not to think of men above that which is written   that no</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;one of you be puffed up for one against another.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>004:007 For who maketh thee to differ from another? and what hast thou</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;that thou didst not receive? now if thou didst receive it   why</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;dost thou glory   as if thou hadst not received it?</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>004:008 Now ye are full   now ye are rich   ye have reigned as kings</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;without us: and I would to God ye did reign   that we also</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;might reign with you.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>004:009 For I think that God hath set forth us the apostles last   as</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;it were appointed to death: for we are made a spectacle unto</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the world   and to angels   and to men.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>004:010 We are fools for Christ's sake   but ye are wise in Christ; we</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;are weak   but ye are strong; ye are honourable   but we are</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;despised.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>004:011 Even unto this present hour we both hunger   and thirst   and</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;are naked   and are buffeted   and have no certain</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;dwellingplace;</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>004:012 And labour   working with our own hands: being reviled   we</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;bless; being persecuted   we suffer it:</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>004:013 Being defamed   we intreat: we are made as the filth of the</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;world   and are the offscouring of all things unto this day.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>004:014 I write not these things to shame you   but as my beloved sons</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;I warn you.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>004:015 For though ye have ten thousand instructers in Christ   yet</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;have ye not many fathers: for in Christ Jesus I have begotten</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;you through the gospel.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>004:016 Wherefore I beseech you   be ye followers of me.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>004:017 For this cause have I sent unto you Timotheus   who is my</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;beloved son   and faithful in the Lord   who shall bring you</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;into remembrance of my ways which be in Christ   as I teach</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;every where in every church.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>004:018 Now some are puffed up   as though I would not come to you.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>004:019 But I will come to you shortly   if the Lord will   and will</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;know   not the speech of them which are puffed up   but the</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;power.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>004:020 For the kingdom of God is not in word   but in power.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>004:021 What will ye? shall I come unto you with a rod   or in love</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;and in the spirit of meekness?</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>005:001 It is reported commonly that there is fornication among you</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;and such fornication as is not so much as named among the</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Gentiles   that one should have his father's wife.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>005:002 And ye are puffed up   and have not rather mourned   that he</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;that hath done this deed might be taken away from among you.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>005:003 For I verily   as absent in body   but present in spirit   have</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;judged already   as though I were present   concerning him that</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;hath so done this deed</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>005:004 In the name of our Lord Jesus Christ   when ye are gathered</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;together   and my spirit   with the power of our Lord Jesus</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Christ</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>005:005 To deliver such an one unto Satan for the destruction of the</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;flesh   that the spirit may be saved in the day of the Lord</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Jesus.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>005:006 Your glorying is not good. Know ye not that a little leaven</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;leaveneth the whole lump?</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>005:007 Purge out therefore the old leaven   that ye may be a new lump</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;as ye are unleavened. For even Christ our passover is</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;sacrificed for us:</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>005:008 Therefore let us keep the feast   not with old leaven   neither</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;with the leaven of malice and wickedness; but with the</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;unleavened bread of sincerity and truth.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>005:009 I wrote unto you in an epistle not to company with</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;fornicators:</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>005:010 Yet not altogether with the fornicators of this world   or with</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the covetous   or extortioners   or with idolaters; for then</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;must ye needs go out of the world.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>005:011 But now I have written unto you not to keep company   if any</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;man that is called a brother be a fornicator   or covetous   or</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;an idolater   or a railer   or a drunkard   or an extortioner;</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;with such an one no not to eat.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>005:012 For what have I to do to judge them also that are without? do</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;not ye judge them that are within?</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>005:013 But them that are without God judgeth. Therefore put away from</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;among yourselves that wicked person.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>006:001 Dare any of you   having a matter against another   go to law</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;before the unjust   and not before the saints?</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>006:002 Do ye not know that the saints shall judge the world? and if</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the world shall be judged by you   are ye unworthy to judge the</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;smallest matters?</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>006:003 Know ye not that we shall judge angels? how much more things</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;that pertain to this life?</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>006:004 If then ye have judgments of things pertaining to this life</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;set them to judge who are least esteemed in the church.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>006:005 I speak to your shame. Is it so   that there is not a wise man</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;among you? no   not one that shall be able to judge between his</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;brethren?</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>006:006 But brother goeth to law with brother   and that before the</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;unbelievers.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>006:007 Now therefore there is utterly a fault among you   because ye</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;go to law one with another. Why do ye not rather take wrong?</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;why do ye not rather suffer yourselves to be defrauded?</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>006:008 Nay   ye do wrong   and defraud   and that your brethren.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>006:009 Know ye not that the unrighteous shall not inherit the kingdom</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;of God? Be not deceived: neither fornicators   nor idolaters</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;nor adulterers   nor effeminate   nor abusers of themselves with</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;mankind</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>006:010 Nor thieves   nor covetous   nor drunkards   nor revilers   nor</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;extortioners   shall inherit the kingdom of God.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>006:011 And such were some of you: but ye are washed   but ye are</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;sanctified   but ye are justified in the name of the Lord</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Jesus   and by the Spirit of our God.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>006:012 All things are lawful unto me   but all things are not</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;expedient: all things are lawful for me   but I will not be</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;brought under the power of any.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>006:013 Meats for the belly   and the belly for meats: but God shall</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;destroy both it and them. Now the body is not for fornication</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;but for the Lord; and the Lord for the body.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>006:014 And God hath both raised up the Lord   and will also raise up</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;us by his own power.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>006:015 Know ye not that your bodies are the members of Christ? shall</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;I then take the members of Christ   and make them the members</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;of an harlot? God forbid.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>006:016 What? know ye not that he which is joined to an harlot is one</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;body? for two   saith he   shall be one flesh.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>006:017 But he that is joined unto the Lord is one spirit.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>006:018 Flee fornication. Every sin that a man doeth is without the</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;body; but he that committeth fornication sinneth against his</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;own body.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>006:019 What? know ye not that your body is the temple of the Holy</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Ghost which is in you   which ye have of God   and ye are not</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;your own?</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>006:020 For ye are bought with a price: therefore glorify God in your</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;body   and in your spirit   which are God's.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>007:001 Now concerning the things whereof ye wrote unto me: It is good</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;for a man not to touch a woman.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>007:002 Nevertheless   to avoid fornication   let every man have his own</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;wife   and let every woman have her own husband.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>007:003 Let the husband render unto the wife due benevolence: and</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;likewise also the wife unto the husband.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>007:004 The wife hath not power of her own body   but the husband: and</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;likewise also the husband hath not power of his own body   but</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the wife.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>007:005 Defraud ye not one the other   except it be with consent for a</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;time   that ye may give yourselves to fasting and prayer; and</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;come together again   that Satan tempt you not for your</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;incontinency.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>007:006 But I speak this by permission   and not of commandment.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>007:007 For I would that all men were even as I myself. But every man</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;hath his proper gift of God   one after this manner   and</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;another after that.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>007:008 I say therefore to the unmarried and widows   It is good for</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;them if they abide even as I.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>007:009 But if they cannot contain   let them marry: for it is better</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;to marry than to burn.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>007:010 And unto the married I command   yet not I   but the Lord   Let</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;not the wife depart from her husband:</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>007:011 But and if she depart   let her remain unmarried or be</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;reconciled to her husband: and let not the husband put away</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;his wife.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>007:012 But to the rest speak I   not the Lord: If any brother hath a</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;wife that believeth not   and she be pleased to dwell with him</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;let him not put her away.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>007:013 And the woman which hath an husband that believeth not   and if</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;he be pleased to dwell with her   let her not leave him.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>007:014 For the unbelieving husband is sanctified by the wife   and the</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;unbelieving wife is sanctified by the husband: else were your</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;children unclean; but now are they holy.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>007:015 But if the unbelieving depart   let him depart. A brother or a</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;sister is not under bondage in such cases: but God hath called</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;us to peace.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>007:016 For what knowest thou   O wife   whether thou shalt save thy</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;husband? or how knowest thou   O man   whether thou shalt save</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;thy wife?</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>007:017 But as God hath distributed to every man   as the Lord hath</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;called every one   so let him walk. And so ordain I in all</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;churches.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>007:018 Is any man called being circumcised? let him not become</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;uncircumcised. Is any called in uncircumcision? let him not be</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;circumcised.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>007:019 Circumcision is nothing   and uncircumcision is nothing   but</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the keeping of the commandments of God.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>007:020 Let every man abide in the same calling wherein he was called.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>007:021 Art thou called being a servant? care not for it: but if thou</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;mayest be made free   use it rather.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>007:022 For he that is called in the Lord   being a servant   is the</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Lord's freeman: likewise also he that is called   being free</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;is Christ's servant.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>007:023 Ye are bought with a price; be not ye the servants of men.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>007:024 Brethren   let every man   wherein he is called   therein abide</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;with God.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>007:025 Now concerning virgins I have no commandment of the Lord: yet</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;I give my judgment   as one that hath obtained mercy of the</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Lord to be faithful.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>007:026 I suppose therefore that this is good for the present</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;distress   I say   that it is good for a man so to be.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>007:027 Art thou bound unto a wife? seek not to be loosed. Art thou</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;loosed from a wife? seek not a wife.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>007:028 But and if thou marry   thou hast not sinned; and if a virgin</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;marry   she hath not sinned. Nevertheless such shall have</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;trouble in the flesh: but I spare you.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>007:029 But this I say   brethren   the time is short: it remaineth</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;that both they that have wives be as though they had none;</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>007:030 And they that weep   as though they wept not; and they that</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;rejoice   as though they rejoiced not; and they that buy   as</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;though they possessed not;</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>007:031 And they that use this world   as not abusing it: for the</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;fashion of this world passeth away.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>007:032 But I would have you without carefulness. He that is unmarried</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;careth for the things that belong to the Lord   how he may</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;please the Lord:</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>007:033 But he that is married careth for the things that are of the</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;world   how he may please his wife.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>007:034 There is difference also between a wife and a virgin. The</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;unmarried woman careth for the things of the Lord   that she</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;may be holy both in body and in spirit: but she that is</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;married careth for the things of the world   how she may please</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;her husband.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>007:035 And this I speak for your own profit; not that I may cast a</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;snare upon you   but for that which is comely   and that ye may</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;attend upon the Lord without distraction.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>007:036 But if any man think that he behaveth himself uncomely toward</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;his virgin   if she pass the flower of her age   and need so</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;require   let him do what he will   he sinneth not: let them</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;marry.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>007:037 Nevertheless he that standeth stedfast in his heart   having no</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;necessity   but hath power over his own will   and hath so</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;decreed in his heart that he will keep his virgin   doeth well.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>007:038 So then he that giveth her in marriage doeth well; but he that</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;giveth her not in marriage doeth better.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>007:039 The wife is bound by the law as long as her husband liveth;</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;but if her husband be dead   she is at liberty to be married to</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;whom she will; only in the Lord.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>007:040 But she is happier if she so abide   after my judgment: and I</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;think also that I have the Spirit of God.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>008:001 Now as touching things offered unto idols   we know that we all</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;have knowledge. Knowledge puffeth up   but charity edifieth.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>008:002 And if any man think that he knoweth any thing   he knoweth</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;nothing yet as he ought to know.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>008:003 But if any man love God   the same is known of him.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>008:004 As concerning therefore the eating of those things that are</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;offered in sacrifice unto idols   we know that an idol is</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;nothing in the world   and that there is none other God but</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;one.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>008:005 For though there be that are called gods   whether in heaven or</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;in earth   (as there be gods many   and lords many  )</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>008:006 But to us there is but one God   the Father   of whom are all</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;things   and we in him; and one Lord Jesus Christ   by whom are</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;all things   and we by him.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>008:007 Howbeit there is not in every man that knowledge: for some</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;with conscience of the idol unto this hour eat it as a thing</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;offered unto an idol; and their conscience being weak is</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;defiled.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>008:008 But meat commendeth us not to God: for neither   if we eat   are</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;we the better; neither   if we eat not   are we the worse.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>008:009 But take heed lest by any means this liberty of your's become</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;a stumblingblock to them that are weak.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>008:010 For if any man see thee which hast knowledge sit at meat in</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the idol's temple   shall not the conscience of him which is</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;weak be emboldened to eat those things which are offered to</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;idols;</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>008:011 And through thy knowledge shall the weak brother perish   for</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;whom Christ died?</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>008:012 But when ye sin so against the brethren   and wound their weak</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;conscience   ye sin against Christ.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>008:013 Wherefore   if meat make my brother to offend   I will eat no</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;flesh while the world standeth   lest I make my brother to</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;offend.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>009:001 Am I not an apostle? am I not free? have I not seen Jesus</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Christ our Lord? are not ye my work in the Lord?</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>009:002 If I be not an apostle unto others   yet doubtless I am to you:</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;for the seal of mine apostleship are ye in the Lord.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>009:003 Mine answer to them that do examine me is this</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>009:004 Have we not power to eat and to drink?</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>009:005 Have we not power to lead about a sister   a wife   as well as</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;other apostles   and as the brethren of the Lord   and Cephas?</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>009:006 Or I only and Barnabas   have not we power to forbear working?</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>009:007 Who goeth a warfare any time at his own charges? who planteth</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;a vineyard   and eateth not of the fruit thereof? or who</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;feedeth a flock   and eateth not of the milk of the flock?</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>009:008 Say I these things as a man? or saith not the law the same</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;also?</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>009:009 For it is written in the law of Moses   Thou shalt not muzzle</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the mouth of the ox that treadeth out the corn. Doth God take</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;care for oxen?</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>009:010 Or saith he it altogether for our sakes? For our sakes   no</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;doubt   this is written: that he that ploweth should plow in</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;hope; and that he that thresheth in hope should be partaker of</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;his hope.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>009:011 If we have sown unto you spiritual things   is it a great thing</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;if we shall reap your carnal things?</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>009:012 If others be partakers of this power over you   are not we</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;rather? Nevertheless we have not used this power; but suffer</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;all things   lest we should hinder the gospel of Christ.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>009:013 Do ye not know that they which minister about holy things live</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;of the things of the temple? and they which wait at the altar</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;are partakers with the altar?</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>009:014 Even so hath the Lord ordained that they which preach the</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;gospel should live of the gospel.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>009:015 But I have used none of these things: neither have I written</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;these things   that it should be so done unto me: for it were</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;better for me to die   than that any man should make my</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;glorying void.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>009:016 For though I preach the gospel   I have nothing to glory of:</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;for necessity is laid upon me; yea   woe is unto me   if I</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;preach not the gospel!</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>009:017 For if I do this thing willingly   I have a reward: but if</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;against my will   a dispensation of the gospel is committed</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;unto me.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>009:018 What is my reward then? Verily that   when I preach the gospel</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;I may make the gospel of Christ without charge   that I abuse</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;not my power in the gospel.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>009:019 For though I be free from all men   yet have I made myself</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;servant unto all   that I might gain the more.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>009:020 And unto the Jews I became as a Jew   that I might gain the</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Jews; to them that are under the law   as under the law   that I</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;might gain them that are under the law;</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>009:021 To them that are without law   as without law   (being not</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;without law to God   but under the law to Christ  ) that I might</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;gain them that are without law.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>009:022 To the weak became I as weak   that I might gain the weak: I am</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;made all things to all men   that I might by all means save</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;some.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>009:023 And this I do for the gospel's sake   that I might be partaker</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;thereof with you.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>009:024 Know ye not that they which run in a race run all   but one</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;receiveth the prize? So run   that ye may obtain.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>009:025 And every man that striveth for the mastery is temperate in</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;all things. Now they do it to obtain a corruptible crown; but</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;we an incorruptible.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>009:026 I therefore so run   not as uncertainly; so fight I   not as one</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;that beateth the air:</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>009:027 But I keep under my body   and bring it into subjection: lest</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;that by any means   when I have preached to others   I myself</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;should be a castaway.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>010:001 Moreover   brethren   I would not that ye should be ignorant</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;how that all our fathers were under the cloud   and all passed</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;through the sea;</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>010:002 And were all baptized unto Moses in the cloud and in the sea;</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>010:003 And did all eat the same spiritual meat;</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>010:004 And did all drink the same spiritual drink: for they drank of</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;that spiritual Rock that followed them: and that Rock was</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Christ.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>010:005 But with many of them God was not well pleased: for they were</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;overthrown in the wilderness.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>010:006 Now these things were our examples   to the intent we should</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;not lust after evil things   as they also lusted.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>010:007 Neither be ye idolaters   as were some of them; as it is</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;written   The people sat down to eat and drink   and rose up to</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;play.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>010:008 Neither let us commit fornication   as some of them committed</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;and fell in one day three and twenty thousand.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>010:009 Neither let us tempt Christ   as some of them also tempted   and</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;were destroyed of serpents.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>010:010 Neither murmur ye   as some of them also murmured   and were</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;destroyed of the destroyer.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>010:011 Now all these things happened unto them for ensamples: and</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;they are written for our admonition   upon whom the ends of the</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;world are come.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>010:012 Wherefore let him that thinketh he standeth take heed lest he</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;fall.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>010:013 There hath no temptation taken you but such as is common to</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;man: but God is faithful   who will not suffer you to be</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;tempted above that ye are able; but will with the temptation</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;also make a way to escape   that ye may be able to bear it.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>010:014 Wherefore   my dearly beloved   flee from idolatry.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>010:015 I speak as to wise men; judge ye what I say.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>010:016 The cup of blessing which we bless   is it not the communion of</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the blood of Christ? The bread which we break   is it not the</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;communion of the body of Christ?</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>010:017 For we being many are one bread   and one body: for we are all</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;partakers of that one bread.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>010:018 Behold Israel after the flesh: are not they which eat of the</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;sacrifices partakers of the altar?</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>010:019 What say I then? that the idol is any thing   or that which is</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;offered in sacrifice to idols is any thing?</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>010:020 But I say   that the things which the Gentiles sacrifice   they</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;sacrifice to devils   and not to God: and I would not that ye</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;should have fellowship with devils.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>010:021 Ye cannot drink the cup of the Lord   and the cup of devils: ye</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;cannot be partakers of the Lord's table   and of the table of</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;devils.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>010:022 Do we provoke the Lord to jealousy? are we stronger than he?</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>010:023 All things are lawful for me   but all things are not</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;expedient: all things are lawful for me   but all things edify</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;not.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>010:024 Let no man seek his own   but every man another's wealth.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>010:025 Whatsoever is sold in the shambles   that eat   asking no</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;question for conscience sake:</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>010:026 For the earth is the Lord's   and the fulness thereof.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>010:027 If any of them that believe not bid you to a feast   and ye be</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;disposed to go; whatsoever is set before you   eat   asking no</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;question for conscience sake.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>010:028 But if any man say unto you   This is offered in sacrifice unto</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;idols   eat not for his sake that shewed it   and for conscience</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;sake: for the earth is the Lord's   and the fulness thereof:</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>010:029 Conscience   I say   not thine own   but of the other: for why is</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;my liberty judged of another man's conscience?</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>010:030 For if I by grace be a partaker   why am I evil spoken of for</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;that for which I give thanks?</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>010:031 Whether therefore ye eat   or drink   or whatsoever ye do   do</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;all to the glory of God.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>010:032 Give none offence   neither to the Jews   nor to the Gentiles</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;nor to the church of God:</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>010:033 Even as I please all men in all things   not seeking mine own</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;profit   but the profit of many   that they may be saved.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>011:001 Be ye followers of me   even as I also am of Christ.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>011:002 Now I praise you   brethren   that ye remember me in all things</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;and keep the ordinances   as I delivered them to you.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>011:003 But I would have you know   that the head of every man is</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Christ; and the head of the woman is the man; and the head of</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Christ is God.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>011:004 Every man praying or prophesying   having his head covered</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;dishonoureth his head.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>011:005 But every woman that prayeth or prophesieth with her head</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;uncovered dishonoureth her head: for that is even all one as</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;if she were shaven.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>011:006 For if the woman be not covered   let her also be shorn: but if</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;it be a shame for a woman to be shorn or shaven   let her be</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;covered.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>011:007 For a man indeed ought not to cover his head   forasmuch as he</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;is the image and glory of God: but the woman is the glory of</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the man.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>011:008 For the man is not of the woman: but the woman of the man.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>011:009 Neither was the man created for the woman; but the woman for</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the man.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>011:010 For this cause ought the woman to have power on her head</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;because of the angels.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>011:011 Nevertheless neither is the man without the woman   neither the</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;woman without the man   in the Lord.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>011:012 For as the woman is of the man   even so is the man also by the</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;woman; but all things of God.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>011:013 Judge in yourselves: is it comely that a woman pray unto God</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;uncovered?</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>011:014 Doth not even nature itself teach you   that   if a man have</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;long hair   it is a shame unto him?</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>011:015 But if a woman have long hair   it is a glory to her: for her</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;hair is given her for a covering.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>011:016 But if any man seem to be contentious   we have no such custom</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;neither the churches of God.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>011:017 Now in this that I declare unto you I praise you not   that ye</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;come together not for the better   but for the worse.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>011:018 For first of all   when ye come together in the church   I hear</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;that there be divisions among you; and I partly believe it.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>011:019 For there must be also heresies among you   that they which are</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;approved may be made manifest among you.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>011:020 When ye come together therefore into one place   this is not to</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;eat the Lord's supper.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>011:021 For in eating every one taketh before other his own supper:</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;and one is hungry   and another is drunken.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>011:022 What? have ye not houses to eat and to drink in? or despise ye</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the church of God   and shame them that have not? What shall I</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;say to you? shall I praise you in this? I praise you not.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>011:023 For I have received of the Lord that which also I delivered</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;unto you   That the Lord Jesus the same night in which he was</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;betrayed took bread:</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>011:024 And when he had given thanks   he brake it   and said   Take</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;eat: this is my body   which is broken for you: this do in</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;remembrance of me.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>011:025 After the same manner also he took the cup   when he had</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;supped   saying   This cup is the new testament in my blood:</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;this do ye   as oft as ye drink it   in remembrance of me.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>011:026 For as often as ye eat this bread   and drink this cup   ye do</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;shew the Lord's death till he come.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>011:027 Wherefore whosoever shall eat this bread   and drink this cup</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;of the Lord   unworthily   shall be guilty of the body and blood</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;of the Lord.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>011:028 But let a man examine himself   and so let him eat of that</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;bread   and drink of that cup.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>011:029 For he that eateth and drinketh unworthily   eateth and</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;drinketh damnation to himself   not discerning the Lord's body.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>011:030 For this cause many are weak and sickly among you   and many</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;sleep.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>011:031 For if we would judge ourselves   we should not be judged.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>011:032 But when we are judged   we are chastened of the Lord   that we</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;should not be condemned with the world.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>011:033 Wherefore   my brethren   when ye come together to eat   tarry</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;one for another.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>011:034 And if any man hunger   let him eat at home; that ye come not</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;together unto condemnation. And the rest will I set in order</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;when I come.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>012:001 Now concerning spiritual gifts   brethren   I would not have you</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;ignorant.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>012:002 Ye know that ye were Gentiles   carried away unto these dumb</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;idols   even as ye were led.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>012:003 Wherefore I give you to understand   that no man speaking by</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the Spirit of God calleth Jesus accursed: and that no man can</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;say that Jesus is the Lord   but by the Holy Ghost.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>012:004 Now there are diversities of gifts   but the same Spirit.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>012:005 And there are differences of administrations   but the same</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Lord.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>012:006 And there are diversities of operations   but it is the same</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;God which worketh all in all.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>012:007 But the manifestation of the Spirit is given to every man to</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;profit withal.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>012:008 For to one is given by the Spirit the word of wisdom; to</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;another the word of knowledge by the same Spirit;</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>012:009 To another faith by the same Spirit; to another the gifts of</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;healing by the same Spirit;</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>012:010 To another the working of miracles; to another prophecy; to</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;another discerning of spirits; to another divers kinds of</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;tongues; to another the interpretation of tongues:</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>012:011 But all these worketh that one and the selfsame Spirit</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;dividing to every man severally as he will.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>012:012 For as the body is one   and hath many members   and all the</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;members of that one body   being many   are one body: so also is</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Christ.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>012:013 For by one Spirit are we all baptized into one body   whether</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;we be Jews or Gentiles   whether we be bond or free; and have</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;been all made to drink into one Spirit.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>012:014 For the body is not one member   but many.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>012:015 If the foot shall say   Because I am not the hand   I am not of</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the body; is it therefore not of the body?</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>012:016 And if the ear shall say   Because I am not the eye   I am not</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;of the body; is it therefore not of the body?</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>012:017 If the whole body were an eye   where were the hearing? If the</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;whole were hearing   where were the smelling?</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>012:018 But now hath God set the members every one of them in the</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;body   as it hath pleased him.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>012:019 And if they were all one member   where were the body?</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>012:020 But now are they many members   yet but one body.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>012:021 And the eye cannot say unto the hand   I have no need of thee:</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;nor again the head to the feet   I have no need of you.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>012:022 Nay   much more those members of the body   which seem to be</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;more feeble   are necessary:</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>012:023 And those members of the body   which we think to be less</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;honourable   upon these we bestow more abundant honour; and our</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;uncomely parts have more abundant comeliness.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>012:024 For our comely parts have no need: but God hath tempered the</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;body together   having given more abundant honour to that part</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;which lacked.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>012:025 That there should be no schism in the body; but that the</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;members should have the same care one for another.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>012:026 And whether one member suffer   all the members suffer with it;</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;or one member be honoured   all the members rejoice with it.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>012:027 Now ye are the body of Christ   and members in particular.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>012:028 And God hath set some in the church   first apostles</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;secondarily prophets   thirdly teachers   after that miracles</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;then gifts of healings   helps   governments   diversities of</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;tongues.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>012:029 Are all apostles? are all prophets? are all teachers? are all</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;workers of miracles?</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>012:030 Have all the gifts of healing? do all speak with tongues? do</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;all interpret?</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>012:031 But covet earnestly the best gifts: and yet shew I unto you a</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;more excellent way.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>013:001 Though I speak with the tongues of men and of angels   and have</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;not charity   I am become as sounding brass   or a tinkling</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;cymbal.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>013:002 And though I have the gift of prophecy   and understand all</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;mysteries   and all knowledge; and though I have all faith   so</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;that I could remove mountains   and have not charity   I am</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;nothing.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>013:003 And though I bestow all my goods to feed the poor   and though</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;I give my body to be burned   and have not charity   it</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;profiteth me nothing.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>013:004 Charity suffereth long   and is kind; charity envieth not;</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;charity vaunteth not itself   is not puffed up</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>013:005 Doth not behave itself unseemly   seeketh not her own   is not</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;easily provoked   thinketh no evil;</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>013:006 Rejoiceth not in iniquity   but rejoiceth in the truth;</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>013:007 Beareth all things   believeth all things   hopeth all things</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;endureth all things.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>013:008 Charity never faileth: but whether there be prophecies   they</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;shall fail; whether there be tongues   they shall cease;</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;whether there be knowledge   it shall vanish away.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>013:009 For we know in part   and we prophesy in part.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>013:010 But when that which is perfect is come   then that which is in</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;part shall be done away.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>013:011 When I was a child   I spake as a child   I understood as a</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;child   I thought as a child: but when I became a man   I put</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;away childish things.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>013:012 For now we see through a glass   darkly; but then face to face:</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;now I know in part; but then shall I know even as also I am</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;known.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>013:013 And now abideth faith   hope   charity   these three; but the</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;greatest of these is charity.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>014:001 Follow after charity   and desire spiritual gifts   but rather</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;that ye may prophesy.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>014:002 For he that speaketh in an unknown tongue speaketh not unto</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;men   but unto God: for no man understandeth him; howbeit in</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the spirit he speaketh mysteries.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>014:003 But he that prophesieth speaketh unto men to edification   and</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;exhortation   and comfort.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>014:004 He that speaketh in an unknown tongue edifieth himself; but he</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;that prophesieth edifieth the church.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>014:005 I would that ye all spake with tongues but rather that ye</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;prophesied: for greater is he that prophesieth than he that</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;speaketh with tongues   except he interpret   that the church</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;may receive edifying.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>014:006 Now   brethren   if I come unto you speaking with tongues   what</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;shall I profit you   except I shall speak to you either by</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;revelation   or by knowledge   or by prophesying   or by</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;doctrine?</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>014:007 And even things without life giving sound   whether pipe or</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;harp   except they give a distinction in the sounds   how shall</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;it be known what is piped or harped?</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>014:008 For if the trumpet give an uncertain sound   who shall prepare</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;himself to the battle?</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>014:009 So likewise ye   except ye utter by the tongue words easy to be</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;understood   how shall it be known what is spoken? for ye shall</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;speak into the air.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>014:010 There are   it may be   so many kinds of voices in the world</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;and none of them is without signification.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>014:011 Therefore if I know not the meaning of the voice   I shall be</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;unto him that speaketh a barbarian   and he that speaketh shall</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;be a barbarian unto me.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>014:012 Even so ye   forasmuch as ye are zealous of spiritual gifts</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;seek that ye may excel to the edifying of the church.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>014:013 Wherefore let him that speaketh in an unknown tongue pray that</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;he may interpret.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>014:014 For if I pray in an unknown tongue   my spirit prayeth   but my</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;understanding is unfruitful.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>014:015 What is it then? I will pray with the spirit   and I will pray</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;with the understanding also: I will sing with the spirit   and</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;I will sing with the understanding also.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>014:016 Else when thou shalt bless with the spirit   how shall he that</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;occupieth the room of the unlearned say Amen at thy giving of</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;thanks   seeing he understandeth not what thou sayest?</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>014:017 For thou verily givest thanks well   but the other is not</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;edified.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>014:018 I thank my God   I speak with tongues more than ye all:</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>014:019 Yet in the church I had rather speak five words with my</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;understanding   that by my voice I might teach others also</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;than ten thousand words in an unknown tongue.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>014:020 Brethren   be not children in understanding: howbeit in malice</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;be ye children   but in understanding be men.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>014:021 In the law it is written   With men of other tongues and other</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;lips will I speak unto this people; and yet for all that will</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;they not hear me   saith the Lord.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>014:022 Wherefore tongues are for a sign   not to them that believe</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;but to them that believe not: but prophesying serveth not for</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;them that believe not   but for them which believe.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>014:023 If therefore the whole church be come together into one place</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;and all speak with tongues   and there come in those that are</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;unlearned   or unbelievers   will they not say that ye are mad?</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>014:024 But if all prophesy   and there come in one that believeth not</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;or one unlearned   he is convinced of all   he is judged of all:</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>014:025 And thus are the secrets of his heart made manifest; and so</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;falling down on his face he will worship God   and report that</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;God is in you of a truth.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>014:026 How is it then   brethren? when ye come together   every one of</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;you hath a psalm   hath a doctrine   hath a tongue   hath a</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;revelation   hath an interpretation. Let all things be done</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;unto edifying.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>014:027 If any man speak in an unknown tongue   let it be by two   or at</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the most by three   and that by course; and let one interpret.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>014:028 But if there be no interpreter   let him keep silence in the</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;church; and let him speak to himself   and to God.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>014:029 Let the prophets speak two or three   and let the other judge.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>014:030 If any thing be revealed to another that sitteth by   let the</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;first hold his peace.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>014:031 For ye may all prophesy one by one   that all may learn   and</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;all may be comforted.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>014:032 And the spirits of the prophets are subject to the prophets.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>014:033 For God is not the author of confusion   but of peace   as in</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;all churches of the saints.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>014:034 Let your women keep silence in the churches: for it is not</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;permitted unto them to speak; but they are commanded to be</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;under obedience as also saith the law.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>014:035 And if they will learn any thing   let them ask their husbands</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;at home: for it is a shame for women to speak in the church.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>014:036 What? came the word of God out from you? or came it unto you</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;only?</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>014:037 If any man think himself to be a prophet   or spiritual   let</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;him acknowledge that the things that I write unto you are the</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;commandments of the Lord.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>014:038 But if any man be ignorant   let him be ignorant.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>014:039 Wherefore   brethren   covet to prophesy   and forbid not to</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;speak with tongues.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>014:040 Let all things be done decently and in order.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>015:001 Moreover   brethren   I declare unto you the gospel which I</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;preached unto you   which also ye have received   and wherein ye</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;stand;</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>015:002 By which also ye are saved   if ye keep in memory what I</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;preached unto you   unless ye have believed in vain.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>015:003 For I delivered unto you first of all that which I also</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;received   how that Christ died for our sins according to the</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;scriptures;</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>015:004 And that he was buried   and that he rose again the third day</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;according to the scriptures:</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>015:005 And that he was seen of Cephas   then of the twelve:</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>015:006 After that   he was seen of above five hundred brethren at</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;once; of whom the greater part remain unto this present   but</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;some are fallen asleep.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>015:007 After that   he was seen of James; then of all the apostles.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>015:008 And last of all he was seen of me also   as of one born out of</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;due time.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>015:009 For I am the least of the apostles   that am not meet to be</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;called an apostle   because I persecuted the church of God.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>015:010 But by the grace of God I am what I am: and his grace which</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;was bestowed upon me was not in vain; but I laboured more</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;abundantly than they all: yet not I   but the grace of God</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;which was with me.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>015:011 Therefore whether it were I or they   so we preach   and so ye</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;believed.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>015:012 Now if Christ be preached that he rose from the dead   how say</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;some among you that there is no resurrection of the dead?</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>015:013 But if there be no resurrection of the dead   then is Christ</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;not risen:</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>015:014 And if Christ be not risen   then is our preaching vain   and</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;your faith is also vain.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>015:015 Yea   and we are found false witnesses of God; because we have</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;testified of God that he raised up Christ: whom he raised not</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;up   if so be that the dead rise not.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>015:016 For if the dead rise not   then is not Christ raised:</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>015:017 And if Christ be not raised   your faith is vain; ye are yet in</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;your sins.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>015:018 Then they also which are fallen asleep in Christ are perished.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>015:019 If in this life only we have hope in Christ   we are of all men</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;most miserable.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>015:020 But now is Christ risen from the dead   and become the</p><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;firstfruits of them that slept.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>015:021 For since by man came death   by man came also
